title: Coombe Crag Roman Quarry
description: Evidence of Roman quarrying activity was discovered at Coombe Crag, a site some 350 meters south of the line of Hadrian's Wall. The quarry was used as a source of building materials for the Wall and at least eight inscriptions were identified on the sandstone cliff.

properties.description: Approximate coordinates of the Roman quarry based on Pastscape Monument no. 12616.
properties.title: Pastscape location of quarry site
